intro: Stranvaesia davidiana var. undulata, commonly known as the undulating stranvaesia, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, undulating leaves that give it its common name, and its flowers are typically small and clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
